item.title: Exceeding Expectations: How Partner Managed Services and the Cisco 360 Partner Program Accelerate Revenue Growth
item.description: üöÄ The Cisco 360 Partner Program emphasizes managed services as a key growth driver for partners. With evolving customer demands, simplicity and agility in technology adoption are crucial. üìä A recent Canalys survey shows that 49% of B2B IT partners view managed services as their top revenue opportunity, surpassing hardware sales. üíº Cisco aims to empower partners to meet these expectations and enhance profitability through this integrated approach. #Cisco360 #ManagedServices #RevenueGrowth…

item.title: Craft your Next-Gen, Open, and AI-Ready Data Center with SONiC and Cisco 8000
item.description: Transform your data center for the AI era with SONiC and Cisco 8000 Series switches. üåê Cisco supports open-source solutions, allowing organizations to choose the network operating system that meets their unique needs. This flexibility is crucial as AI/ML demands evolve. Disaggregated architectures enable independent scaling and resource control, promoting efficiency and adaptability. Explore how Cisco’s innovations can enhance your operations. üíª‚ú® #DataCenter #AI #Cisco #Networking #OpenSource

item.title: Canadian Bacon Cybersecurity: SharePoint Vulnerabilities and Vulnerabilities in General
item.description: üì¢ Understanding SharePoint Vulnerabilities The article highlights vulnerabilities in Microsoft SharePoint and how they can be exploited by adversaries. Key factors include remotely accessible systems and weak endpoint protections. To mitigate these risks, patching is essential, though not always timely. Implementing remote access via VPN or zero trust access can enhance security. Stay informed and secure! üîê #Cybersecurity #SharePoint #Vulnerabilities #DataProtection #ZeroTrust

item.title: Connected Intelligence: Building the workplace of today for the workforce of tomorrow‚Äã
item.description: The article “Connected Intelligence: Building the workplace of today for the workforce of tomorrow” discusses the transformative impact of artificial intelligence on modern work environments. It highlights how collaboration is now defined by the integration of human and artificial intelligence. This evolution changes not just where we work, but how we connect and innovate together. To harness this potential, new models of collaboration are needed, linking people, AI, and even AI systems….

item.title: How Cisco IT streamlined network operations with Cisco Catalyst Center and Splunk
item.description: Cisco IT has effectively streamlined its network operations using the Catalyst Center and Splunk. By leveraging AI and automation, they achieved a 97% reduction in code vulnerabilities and cut software upgrade times by 59%. This transformation has improved job satisfaction for engineers and enhanced overall network management. With over 200,000 devices to manage, automation has been crucial in reducing manual tasks and minimizing human error. #Cisco #NetworkManagement #Automation #AI…

item.title: From Workloads to Factories: Rethinking the Data Center for AI
item.description: üöÄ Rethinking data centers is essential for AI. Cisco emphasizes transitioning from traditional workloads to AI “factories.” These factories require standardized, scalable units that ensure consistent performance across hybrid environments. Cisco’s Secure AI Factory integrates compute, networking, and security for effective AI deployment. Learn more about the future of data centers! #DataCenter #AI #Cisco #Innovation #Technology

item.title: Rethinking AI Security: The Dynamic Context Firewall for MCP
item.description: üîí As AI becomes integral to business workflows, securing interactions with external tools is essential. The Dynamic Context Firewall (DCF) is a proposed security layer for the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enhancing adaptive AI security. Unlike traditional firewalls, the DCF analyzes AI interactions in real-time, considering context and intent to ensure proper access control. This innovative approach aims to tackle risks such as unauthorized data access and consent fatigue. #AISecurity…

item.title: How One Cisco Product Inspired Me to Break into Tech

This early experience fueled his passion for technology. As a first-generation college student, Adil reflects on how this internship feels like a full-circle moment in his career path. üíª #Cisco #TechJourney #Internship #Inspiration #FirstGen

item.description: üöõ Kistler Group‚Äôs KiTraffic Digital, utilizing Cisco industrial switches, enhances traffic safety by identifying overloaded trucks on highways. The automated weighing system by Thurgau Traffic and Lake Police effectively addresses this issue. #TrafficSafety…

item.title: Lessons from an AI-Assisted Content Migration
item.description: üöÄ After a comprehensive documentation migration project, I’ve gathered valuable lessons on using AI effectively in content engineering. Expertise is essential; AI is a tool, not a replacement. #ContentMigration #AI #DITA #TechDocumentation #Efficiency

item.description: üöÄ Cisco has unveiled groundbreaking software that enables distributed quantum computing, releasing three research prototypes to enhance its quantum networking strategy. üîπ The Quantum Compiler allows quantum algorithms to operate across multiple processors. üîπ Quantum Alert provides eavesdropper-proof security based on physical guarantees. üîπ Quantum Sync facilitates coordinated decision-making using entanglement. Join Cisco’s Quantum Summit next week for live demonstrations! üåê #QuantumComputing…

item.title: Sustainability 101: What is packaging sustainability?

item.title: Driving IT Sustainability in the AI Era
